content: The `String` class represents a sequence of characters. There exist a variety of methods within the `String` class for identifying specific characters within the string, for comparing strings, and searching for substrings.
name: String

methods.name: String
methods.content: Creates a `String` object that represents the same sequence of characters as the argument

methods.name: compareTo
methods.content:
The `compareTo()` method compares the `String` values and returns an `int`. The returned `int` is the number difference between two `String`s. Both `String`s are compared by the Unicode value of each character in the `String`. 

- If `stringOne` is greater than `stringTwo`, the method will return a positive number. "Greater than" means lexicographically greater than, so when `stringOne` comes after `stringTwo`.

- If `stringOne` is less than `stringTwo`, the method will return a negative number. "Less than" means lexicographically less than, so when `stringOne` comes before `stringTwo`.

- If `stringOne` equals `stringTwo`, the method will return `0`.

The `compareTo()` method is case sensitive, meaning that capitalization does affect the calculation.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"stringTwo","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the `String` to be compared to the calling `String` object\n"}]

methods.name: equals
methods.content: The `equals()` method will compare the string that it is called on as well as the string passed as a parameter. The expression returns `true` if the two `String` contains the same sequence of characters, `false` otherwise.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"stringTwo","type":"String","required":true,"description":"the second `String` being compared to the calling `String`"}]

methods.name: indexOf
methods.content: The `indexOf()` method returns the index for the first occurrence of the specified character(s) in a `String` or `-1` if the specified character(s) is not found in the `String`.

methods.name: length
methods.content: The `length()` method returns the number of characters in the specified `String`.

methods.name: substring
methods.content: The `substring()` method returns a `String` containing the characters from the specified starting index to the end of the `String`.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"start","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the index of the first character to start at"}]

methods.name: substring
methods.content: The `substring()` method returns a `String` containing the characters from the specified starting index up to (but not including) the specified ending index.
methods.parameters: [{"name":"start","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the index of the first character to start at"},{"name":"end","type":"int","required":true,"description":"the index of the last character to stop at"}]

methods.name: toString
toLowerCase
methods.content: The `toLowerCase()` method returns the `String` converted to lowercase letters.

methods.name: toUpperCase
methods.content: The `toUpperCase()` method returns the `String` converted to uppercase letters.
